channel.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic
channel.description: talk about it here, until we get our own forums for it. and yes, it is official and it's coming.

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:794, topic:392665"][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=489838.msg4422872#msg4422872 date=1399296855]
Yeah, come on lads sort it out. If you’ve managed to “barely learn” Java then you can “barely learn” Scala too… it’s not fundamentally more difficult.
[/quote]
Why would they bother? If you can just choose another source without scala. [/quote]They don’t need to learn Scala… They can create Java classes and interact with Scala parts as if it was written in Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:790, topic:392665"][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=489838.msg4422836#msg4422836 date=1399280281]

It does draw awareness to the project for those interested in checking out how it was written but without a centralized DDoS protected server being operated by a dedicated individual, projects will go inactive. What I like the most is that this project was made available through GitHub. I greatly respect those who believe in open source. Perhaps it is time to unsticky this topic though and close the Moparscape Classic boards. MoparClassic could still be revived but there are several elements that I personally would take out, such as the use of scala and reddit authentication. I can appreciate what scala is capable of but for everyday use, much of what was added felt as if it was added for the sake of using scala instead of improving functionality or response time. I know that I am still a novice with programming and perhaps I am mistaken about scala but from what I have observed, that is my opinion about it right now.
[/quote]Using Scala made a lot of the codebase easier to deal with. I don’t understand why people keep acting like it’s magic and oh so different from Java. If you know Java, then you should be able to understand the Scala.

That might be the case for you, but many here barely know Java. Just enough to make few edits here and there. Mixing scala into it made that even harder, which is why people prefer DarkQuest over MoparClassic.[/quote]Most of the Scala stuff is in things that they shouldn’t be editing, or in places where it makes it much easier if you use Scala. The places that people would be editing, that are written in Scala (object action handlers and npc handlers), have a ton of examples for them to look at. In addition, if they’re adding new things, they can just do it in Java…

Read full topic
item.source: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic

item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

It does draw awareness to the project for those interested in checking out how it was written but without a centralized DDoS protected server being operated by a dedicated individual, projects will go inactive. What I like the most is that this project was made available through GitHub. I greatly respect those who believe in open source. Perhaps it is time to unsticky this topic though and close the Moparscape Classic boards. MoparClassic could still be revived but there are several elements that I personally would take out, such as the use of scala and reddit authentication. I can appreciate what scala is capable of but for everyday use, much of what was added felt as if it was added for the sake of using scala instead of improving functionality or response time. item.description:
@malikz wrote:

This thread is dead. Mopar failed to deliver, just like on the other rs2 server. Although I don’t agree with kizl’s method, I’m not really against it either. The people who are tired of waiting years to be told nothing was done, should be redirected to a server that’s actually being worked on.

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

If you automate a stats dump then you could do it more frequently than once a day. Just create a view over the player usernames and stats, dump that view periodically, json it, scp the json file to the remote host.
We’re not talking millions of accounts, so doing it should have minimal impact.

Read full topic
item.source: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Subreddit sounds awesome.
Any ideas on a good place to host the hs page?

I’ll PM you.

Read full topic
item.source: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:776, topic:392665”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=489838.msg4349705#msg4349705 date=1376447988]

Well if this project is ready for another round… I’ll provide the hosting.
Just saying.
[/quote]Want me to set a milestone that we can aim to hit before you set anything up?

Yea we can do that. How do you feel about the thought of registration via the client since we don’t have access to moparscape (web-end of things, I know we wanted to create a rsc website and have our own forums…) and everything will be ran through mysql or some datastorage. Maybe create a client sided high scores system/UI…

I’d like to keep the initial goals of this project in mind and relate it to moparscape. With that being said… I don’t want to claim it as our own server but instead the communities. I’ll just be providing the hosting with access to a select few.[/quote]Ya, I’d prefer registration through the client. We could create our own subreddit and use it as forums, so you don’t need to host them.

As for highscores or something, we could always just strip everything but the stats from a backup and send it to a remote server on a daily basis for it to generate highscores. If we used the JSON storage medium, we could then just remove some fields and merge them into an array, then just hand it to a static page and have some JS generate them.

Also, I’ve edited the beta milestone:

GitHub

MoparClassic/MoparClassic

MoparClassic - An emulator for an old java MMORPG

Read full topic
item.source: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic

item.title: Official Moparscape RSC Server - General Discussion Topic
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:774, topic:392665”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=489838.msg4349691#msg4349691 date=1376446435]
Well if this project is ready for another round… I’ll provide the hosting.
Just saying.
[/quote]Want me to set a milestone that we can aim to hit before you set anything up?[/quote]

Yea we can do that. How do you feel about the thought of registration via the client since we don’t have access to moparscape (web-end of things, I know we wanted to create a rsc website and have our own forums…) and everything will be ran through mysql or some datastorage. Maybe create a client sided high scores system/UI…

I’d like to keep the initial goals of this project in mind and relate it to moparscape. With that being said… I don’t want to claim it as our own server but instead the communities. I’ll just be providing the hosting with access to a select few.

tigerclan:

Would be pretty legit if you guys actually got this rolling. the source is definitely the most solid imo

I am pretty sure it was up for over a year but nothing ever official. It was pretty epic, I must say.

Read full topic
